item.description:
The Players’ Ring kicks off its 20th season with

At My Window, a moving new drama by first-time playwright Kathleen Cavalaro (who directed last season’s big hit, Biloxi Blues).

Cavalaro describes At My Window as “a grown-up coming of age story” — one that explores the relationship between two unlikely people who meet at vulnerable points in their lives, creating a bond that will change each of them, forever. Though not a “musical,” the show also focuses on the powerful human need for artistic expression, and includes an original song — with lyrics by Cavalaro and music by San Francisco-based singer/songwriter Nolan Love.

Starring Elizabeth Locke (Rowena in Biloxi Blues) and E. Christopher Clark (from last season’s An Evening of Steampunk and Robot Theater).

**Not intended for young audiences due to brief nudity & sexual content** 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

We're meeting at   Agave Mexican Bistro, 111 State St. @ 6pm for drinks/dinner.  (Drink/appetizer combos for only $8.)

...let me know if you're coming so I can reserve a table.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Tickets: $15 each ($12 Senior/Student/Members)

Arrive 7:30, show begins @ 8pm. 

 Reserve by phone at 603/ 436*8123. Then pay cash or check at the door. No credit cards.  Or, buy tickets online.  These shows do sell out so make sure you reserve!

The Players' Ring Theater -  Since 1992, the mission of The Players' Ring has been to promote the efforts of local artists through the production of original works, while providing an affordable theatre space to local production companies. “The Ring” as we know and love it, nurtures all artists and provides an environment where artists can thrive, grow, take risks and make daring choices. The Players' Ring is located in a nineteenth century brick building on Marcy Street on the grounds of Prescott Park in Portsmouth, New Hampshire. The historic building is owned by the City of Portsmouth and is fitted out as a “black box” theatre. With a seating capacity of 75, The Players' Ring annual attendance is approximately 6,500. Since its creation, more than 30 local production companies have presented plays at The Players' Ring. While some form to produce a single special event, some production companies produce shows on an annual basis. Over 200 actors, directors, playwrights and technicians work together to produce plays at The Players' Ring each year. Over the past five years, over $180,000 has been distributed to those involved in Players' Ring productions. Original works account for half of each season’s offerings.
item.name: At My Window @ The Players' Ring
